DOC.brief_title: Cervical Volume Three-Dimensional Ultrasound Predictor Preterm Delivery
DOC.detailed_description: Preterm labor lead cause perinatal morbidity mortality . Several investigator report ultrasound evaluation cervix predict risk preterm delivery . Three-dimensional ultrasound may provide additional information best counsel parent chance premature birth . This technology capability accurate volume measurement irregular structure superior conventional ultrasound . Therefore , possible three-dimensional ultrasound method may better characterize cervical change risk preterm delivery . Our protocol attempt identify prognostic indicator adverse pregnancy outcome three-dimensional ultrasound . A maximum 680 pregnant woman diagnosis preterm labor prospectively study characterize cervical morphology volume predictor preterm delivery risk . These result correlate maternal fetal biological marker , placental pathology pregnancy outcome . We also compare performance conventional two-dimensional endovaginal ultrasound three-dimensional ultrasound finding . This information expect improve understanding nature time cervical volume change relation pregnancy outcome .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA PRETERM LABOR AND INTACT MEMBRANES : 1 . Singleton gestation ; 2 . Estimated gestational age 20 35 week gestation ; 3 Intact membrane ; 4 . Signed informed consent voluntary participation serial endovaginal scan . EXCLUSION CRITERIA PRETERM LABOR AND INTACT MEMBRANES : 1 . Absent fetal cardiac activity ; 2 . Desire vaginal ultrasound scan . INCLUSION CRITERIA PATIENTS AT RISK FOR PRETERM DELIVERY : 1 . Estimated gestational age 16 < 24 week gestation ; 2 . Planned cerclage placement due increase preterm labor risk ( i.e. , short cervix dilate cervix ) ; 3 . Intact membrane ; 4 . Signed informed consent voluntary participation serial endovaginal scan . EXCLUSION CRITERIA PATIENTS AT RISK FOR PRETERM DELIVERY : 1 . Absent fetal cardiac activity ; 2 . Desire vaginal ultrasound scan . INCLUSION CRITERIA PATIENTS IN SPONTANEOUS LABOR AT TERM : 1 . Term gestation ( great 37 week ) ; 2 . Intact membrane ; 3 . Cervical dilatation le 2 cm ; 4 . Signed informed consent voluntary participation serial endovaginal scan . EXCLUSION CRITERIA PATIENTS IN SPONTANEOUS LABOR AT TERM : 1 . Absent fetal cardiac activity ; 2 . Desire vaginal ultrasound scan . INCLUSION CRITERIA PATIENTS UNDERGOING ELECTIVE INDUCTION OF LABOR : 1 . Term gestation ( great 37 week ) ; 2 . Intact membrane ; 3 . Signed informed consent voluntary participation serial endovaginal scan . EXCLUSION CRITERIA PATIENTS UNDERGOING ELECTIVE INDUCTION OF LABOR : 1 . Absent fetal cardiac activity ; 2 . Desire vaginal ultrasound scan .
